channel.title: Wut does String name = command.substring(10); mean?
channel.description: what exactly does this mean? as im having troube with it on my server atm, sometimes i type ::giveowner wolfy and it shows cant give owner to erwolfy and sometimes i need to add 2 spaces via ::giveowner wolfy, any help with this issue?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 09:36:00 pm[/size][hr]im pretty sure this is the cause of the problem so any1's help is needed[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 09:45:04 pm[/size][hr]bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 10:08:45 pm[/size][hr]so no1 knows?

item.title: Wut does String name = command.substring(10); mean?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“slick, post:1, topic:282396”]what exactly does this mean? as im having troube with it on my server atm, sometimes i type ::giveowner wolfy and it shows cant give owner to erwolfy
and sometimes i need to add 2 spaces via ::giveowner wolfy, any help with this issue?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 09:36:00 pm[/size][hr]im pretty sure this is the cause of the problem so any1’s help is needed[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 09:45:04 pm[/size][hr]bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 10:08:45 pm[/size][hr]so no1 knows?[/quote]it does exactly what the method says. It returns a sub-string of the string. the argument you send into it is where to start.

Read full topic
item.source: Wut does String name = command.substring(10); mean?

item.title: Wut does String name = command.substring(10); mean?
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

String command = “Hello world!”;

command.substring(6) starts at the 5th letter, so command.substring(6) would be “world!”, the 6th letter (0 included) and on.

Read full topic
